resources.string: We are students at Syracuse University\n Bryan Sweeney, Joanna Huiying Wu, and Matt Mawson (mmawson@syr.edu)

Monikers is a party game based on public domain game Celebrity. Two teams, comprised of two or more players each, come together for a minimum of four players. To start the game, any player can use their mobile phone and enter five monikers, which can be anyone or anything - real or fictitious.
 The game takes place over 3 rounds. In the first round, players may use any words they like as clues for their partners to guess.
 In the second round, players may only use 1 word as a clue.
 In the third round, players may only use gestures to communicate with their team.
 The team with the most points after 3 rounds wins.
